title: Top 10 Reasons Why The Justice League Is Better Than The Avengers

json.text:
Top 10 REASONS WHY THE JUSTICE LEAGUE IS BETTER
THAN THE AVENGERS

INTRO:
Welcome back nerd squad, my name is Roya Destroyaa
and this is Top 10 Nerd.
The Justice league as a team debuted in 1960.
The Avengers first assembled in 1963.
Both are teams consisting of superhero powerhouses.

On the surface they seem evenly matched, but
when you really examine the two teams, the

JLA has a few advantages that could potentially
edge them out on top.

So letÕs take a look at the top 10 REASONS
WHY THE JLA IS BETTER THAN THE AVENGERS.

Theoretically, of courseÑif you want the
flip side to this video just give a shout.
In the number 10 spot, we have THE LADIES.

For a long time comics have struggled in having
superhero role models who were female.

DC broke out of this conundrum with the introduction
of Wonder Woman in 1941, who is basically
the queen of the superheroines.

Other notable members have included Vixen,
one of the earliest black female super heroes,

and Black Canary, who was created to be sexy
yet never a damsel in distress.

Marvel has definitely caught up to leading
ladies, but not quite in the way the JLA ladies
have.
Coming in at number 9 is A BETTER TEAM DYNAMIC.

When you are a part of a team, especially
one as large as the JLA or Avengers, you need
organization.
You need a hierarchy.

Everyone knows their place in the Justice
League; there is a defined leadership with

Superman as the ultimate head of the team,
but each member brings to the table something
that the others alone do not provide.

Yes, they do have their moments of squabbles,
but keep it diplomatic.

But on the other hand, the Avengers get majorly
divided on issues.
Can we say civil war?
Next, at number 8 are THE VILLAINS.

The better the villains have been, the more
trained a team will be after having to face
said villains.

The Justice League have powerhouse enemies
like Darkseid, and maniacal psychopaths like
the Joker.

So they are not just well-versed in combat,
they also have to be thinking on their feet
at all times.

The Avengers do have some pretty major villains
like Thanos and Loki, but these guys are outclassed
by the DC villains in most depertments.
In the number 7 spot IS THE BETTER SPEEDSTER.

When it comes right down to it, we could probably
compare each individual member to their counterpart,

but that would probably be a whole video of
top 10 versus right there.

Easily enough to claim is that when he taps
into the speed force, the Flash is going to
outpace Quicksilver.

This isnÕt reason enough to say that the
JLA is better because of one dude, but it

provides an example of how the DC lineup is
always one-upping their Marvel counterparts.
Almost to the point of disbelief.

Coming in at number 6 IS ACCESS TO THE POWER
RING.

Never mind Superman, Green Lantern could be
the secret key in the Justice League topping
out over the Avengers.
This all comes down to the power ring.

With enough willpower, Green Lantern can think
up any construct and use it to take down his
pick of the avengers.

No, itÕs not fair, yes itÕs incredibly OP.
DC doesnÕt like to make weak charactersÑmaybe

they should give it a try, spice things up
a little.
Next up, at number 5, THEY ARE RICHER.

If youÕre going to assemble the team at the
top, youÕre gonna need the cashiola to do
so.

No, more money doesnÕt translate automatically
to better.
But it does help.

The Avengers do have Tony Stark and Black
Panther, but then weÕve got JLA members such

as Bruce Wayne and his enterprise, Aquaman
and his treasures, Oliver Queen the celebrity

business man, Wonderwoman and her historic
riches.

And that money can definitely fund a lot of
transportation, hadquarters, and technology
needs.

Up next at number 4 IS THE WILLINGNESS TO
LAY DOWN THEIR LIVES.

When it comes to it, the Justice League know
their job is to protect the world, and theyÕre
willing to do everything it takes.
Even if it means at the cost of their life.

Flash from Crisis on Infinite Earth ran so
fast he created a power vortex to save the
Earth, but died in the process.

Green Lantern accepted death as the price
for restarting the sun in final night.

They are just more willing to go the extra
mile for unselfish reasons.

In the number 3 spot IS THEIR DARKER ORIGIN
STORIES.

Some of the Avengers do have interesting parts
of their stories, like Hank PymÕs mental
illness and the HulkÕs struggle with rage.

But itÕs the backstories of the Justice League
characters that really steal the spotlight.
Batman was shaped by the traumas of his childhood.

Cyborg was forced to be a test subject by
his own parents.

Superman was removed from his own world and
forced to assimilate to the human world.

ItÕs the pain that fuels them, and also provides
an interesting edge over their Marvel conterparts.
Coming in at number 2 is ICONICITY.

Even before you probably knew what a comic
book was, you knew who Batman and Superman
and Wonderwoman were.

The Marvel heroes have over time accumulated
quite the stories, but nothing in size or

stature as compared to the icnic names of
the Dc roster.

Their stories are more complex, longer, and
limitless in what could happen.

Meanwhile, a lot of the Avengers characters
are considered more secondary.

Although it would be great to branch off and
hear more about them.

And finally, in the number 1 spot, THEY WERE
THE ORIGINAL TEAM.

When it comes right down to it, the Justice
League was around first.

ItÕs kind of only because Marvel owner at
the time, Martin Goodman, was told how well

the Justice League was selling, that he mentioned
to Stan Lee to come up with his own team concept.

The Fantastic 4 actually came first, followed
by the Avengers, and that hit the mark.
So thanks to the JLA.

So those were the top 10 REASONS THE JUSTICE
LEAGUE IS BETTER THAN THE AVENGERS.

Let me know in the comment section down below
if you want the vice versa of this video.

My name is Roya Destroyaa, thanks for watching,
and donÕt forget to subscribe so you never
miss another nerdy list!
